properties.areaDesc: Indiana, PA; Beaver, PA; Butler, PA; Clarion, PA; Mercer, PA; Armstrong, PA; Jefferson, PA; Lawrence, PA
properties.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 8 at 9:21AM EST until January 8 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Pittsburgh PA
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Pittsburgh has issued a

* Snow Squall Warning for...
Southeastern Mercer County in northwestern Pennsylvania...
Northern Beaver County in western Pennsylvania...
Lawrence County in western Pennsylvania...
Northeastern Indiana County in west central Pennsylvania...
Butler County in west central Pennsylvania...
Southwestern Jefferson County in west central Pennsylvania...
Armstrong County in west central Pennsylvania...
Southern Clarion County in west central Pennsylvania...

* Until 1000 AM EST.

* At 921 AM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line
extending from near New Bethlehem to 7 miles southwest of Oakwood,
moving southeast at 30 mph.

HAZARD...Extremely poor visibility in snow and blowing snow. Wind
gusts up to 30 mph.

SOURCE...Radar and webcams.

IMPACT...Expect hazardous road conditions.

* This includes the following highways...
Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 3 and 26.
Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 81 and 107.
Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 11 and 35.

Locations impacted include...
Cranberry, New Castle, Butler, Beaver Falls, Punxsutawney,
Kittanning, Rimersburg, Ellwood City, Homeacre-Lyndora, New Brighton,
Shanor-Northvue and Meridian.
properties.instruction:
Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes
your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra
time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead
to accidents.

Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the
visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.

CMAMtext: Snow Squall Warning til 10:00 AM EST. Sudden whiteouts. Icy roads. Slow down! -NWS
